pronunciation:
FRO'WARD [Latin versus:turned or looking from.]
Perverse,

definition.text:
that is, turning from, with aversion or reluctance; not willing to yield or comply with what is required; unyielding; ungovernable; refractory; disobedient; peevish; as a froward child.
They are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith. Deuteronomy 3 2:20.
